newsitem.title: HUNGARY: BUDAPEST FOREX FUTURES FOCUS ON YEN, STERLING.
newsitem.headline: BUDAPEST FOREX FUTURES FOCUS ON YEN, STERLING.

text.p: Rising yen and mixed sterling futures were in focus in the currency section of the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) on Friday, the bourse said on its Reuters pages.
Currency futures turnover on the BCE totalled 7.37 billion forints, or 27,559 lots on Friday, up from 5.74 billion forints on Thursday.
The yen changed hands in 3,335 lots and rose for all the traded maturities.
The sterling, which has been active recently on the interest of speculants around the U.K. elections, traded in 5,300 lots, of which June accounted for 4,690 lots.
The sterling rose for June, but dropped for September and December.
The dollar, which also fell on the spot currency market, eased for all the traded maturities.
Currency futures on the Budapest Stock Exchange remained untraded on Friday.
